intro: Tetranthera lusona, commonly known as the Lusona tetranthera, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and opposite leaves. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
